meta.title: Home Learning Resources - Northshore School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: To support families during this challenging time amidst the COVID-19 coronavirus outbreak, we have compiled a list of resources to continue the process of home learning.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Home Learning Resources, Northshore School District
To support families during this challenging time amidst the COVID-19 coronavirus outbreak, we have compiled a list of resources to continue the process of home learning.
Home Learning Resources - Northshore School District

article.class: fsResource fsResourceTypeImage

p.span: We invite families to use this unique time to enrich theirstudent's learning, while encouraging creativity and project-focused learning that harnessesstudent's natural curiosity and creativity.

div.p: It is important to keep consistency for your child during these challenging times. We recommend creating a daily routine for your child. The schedule can be flexible to meet the needs of your family.
For technology support with district devices and district student accounts, please call425-408-7669.

p.em: Before accessing materials with your student, we also recommend reviewing the importance of Digital Citizenship.

p.strong: We highly encourage parents and guardians to read the terms and privacy policies before creating an account for any of the following resources.

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsGrid gray fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailLarge fsItemCount_0

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-773 fsTag-774 fsTag-780

div.p: Abdo is an online digital library that is offering a free trial and is accessible via library.nsd.org.
Use:District Owned (access via library.nsd.org) or they are offering a free trial, family has the option to subscribe

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1224 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1223 fsCategory-1262 fsTag-773 fsTag-774

div.a: AP Students College Board (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Students will be required to use their information from their AP courses to log into the site. Resources and courses for students that are currently taking an Advanced Placement course.
Subject(s): Social Studies, Math, Science, English, Computer Science, Psychology

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1258 fsTag-769 fsTag-771 fsTag-787

div.a: Art Docent Frameworks (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: All of the frameworks used in our NSD Art Docent Program are available online. Feel free to use these at home and to adapt to make them work with the resources you have available.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1255 fsTag-781

div.p: The American Speech-Language-Hearing Association provides a wide range of resources to support speech and language development.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1245 fsCategory-1261 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-782 fsTag-795

div.a: A Trauma-Informed Approach to Teaching Through Coronavirus (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Experts from the National Child Traumatic Stress Network share their recommendations for educators supporting students during the COVID-19 crisis.
This article is also valuable for families to read and learn new says to support their children.
Subject(s): Social Emotional, Parent and Guardian

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-772 fsTag-777 fsTag-778 fsTag-780

div.p: For as long as schools are closed, Audible is available. Kids everywhere can instantly stream an incredible collection of stories, including titles across six different languages, that will help them continue dreaming, learning, and just being kids.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1262 fsTag-771

div.p: Founded by a math-minded mom who holds an astrophysics degree from Princeton, BEDTIME MATH posts a mathematical problem (and answer) each day. Parents can share the exercise with kids through the site or receive it in a daily email.Mathematical challenges feature four questions: one for wee, little, and big kidsand a more difficult option for older users.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1223 fsTag-773 fsTag-774

div.p: Bozeman Science provides tutorial video on a variety of science concepts.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1258 fsCategory-1262 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1223 fsCategory-1224 fsCategory-1256 fsCategory-1259 fsCategory-1255 fsCategory-1267 fsCategory-1260 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-773 fsTag-774 fsTag-780 fsTag-781 fsTag-787 fsTag-794 fsTag-798

div.p: BrainPOP is an animated education site for kids covering a wide range of topics such as science, social studies, English, math, arts, music, health, and technology.
Use:District Owned. Contact your teacher, who will set up a class that you can join.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-777 fsTag-778 fsTag-785

div.p: Capstone Interactive is a collection of eBooks and every title includes audio recorded versions read aloud.
Use:District Owned (access via library.nsd.org and then using your Northshore account to view the password here)

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1269 fsCategory-1223 fsTag-772

div.p: Students may access a variety of interactive readings and graphics to learn chemistry content.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1221 fsTag-769 fsTag-771 fsTag-777 fsTag-778 fsTag-780

div.p: Children's Library provides free children's books in a wide range of languages.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1223 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-772

div.a: cK-12 Exploration Series (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: This resource provides interactive components and simulations on a variety of science concepts.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1267 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-769 fsTag-771

div.a: Classics For Kids (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Classics for Kids includes fun games exploring classical music and composers.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1269 fsCategory-1280 fsTag-782

div.p: Cocoon is a social media site for family sharing.

Use:
Families have the choice to subscribe

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1223 fsCategory-1259 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-773 fsTag-774

div.p: Code.org is committed to providing students of all ages with the opportunity to learn about coding.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1221 fsTag-777

div.p: Colorn Colorado provides families with information on how to support English language development.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1269 fsCategory-1221 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-772

div.p: CommonLitis a nonprofit education technology organization dedicated to ensuring that all students graduate with the reading, writing, communication, and problem-solving skills they need to be successful in college and beyond.
Use: Parents have the option to subscribe

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1245 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1224 fsCategory-1256 fsCategory-1255 fsCategory-1223 fsCategory-1280 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-773 fsTag-774 fsTag-780 fsTag-782

div.a: Common Sense Media (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Common Sense Media provides resources on digital citizenship and supporting families with engaging in technology.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1280 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-782

div.a: Common Sense Media: Free Online Games for Kids (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Common Sense Media has created a collection of free online games for kids. The provide recommended age ranges and star ratings.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1255 fsTag-780 fsTag-781

div.p: do2Learn provides a wide variety of tools including visual schedules, picture cards, communication prompts and more!

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1261 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-780 fsTag-795

div.a: Early Childhood Weekly Schedule Example (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: To provide additional support for families, we've created sample schedules you can use as a template to create your student's own daily routine.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1258 fsCategory-1269 fsCategory-1245 fsTag-772 fsTag-795

div.p: Hamilton and The Gilder Lehrman Institute of American History are launching a free program #EduHam at Home to encourage teens and families to create their own theatrical pieces.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1268 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-770 fsTag-773 fsTag-774

div.p: Erin's Challenge is a series of videos and lessons for learning Japanese independently.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1223 fsTag-769 fsTag-771 fsTag-773 fsTag-774 fsTag-786

div.p: Located in San Francisco, California, the Exploratorium is a public learning laboratory exploring the world through science, art, and human perception. Our mission is to create inquiry-based experiences that transform learning worldwide. Our vision is a world where people think for themselves and can confidently ask questions, question answers, and understand the world around them.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1223 fsTag-774

div.p: Explore NASA include videos, projects, and activities for high schoolers to explore in a variety of topics. Highly engaging and inquiry based which students may select based on interest.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1255 fsTag-780 fsTag-781

div.p: This daily calendar provides a daily fine motor and gross motor activity.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1255 fsTag-781

div.a: Fine Motor and Handwriting Development Activities (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Students can practice their fine motor skills through this list of recommended resources.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1269 fsCategory-1280 fsTag-782

div.p: Franktown Rocks is a mutliplayer online music game for kids.

Use:
Families have the choice to subscribe

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1269 fsCategory-1259 fsCategory-1262 fsCategory-1223 fsTag-770

div.p: Boeing and Discovery Education have launched FUTURE U. to inspire and equip the next generation of STEM professionals in aerospace. FUTURE U. offers hands-on learning experiences to help students embrace their potential to make an impact and innovate for the future.
Subject(s): Math, Science, Technical Writing, Projects

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1280 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-782

div.p: Gecko life is a social media platform for family sharing.

Use:
Families have the choice to subscribe

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1260 fsCategory-1280 fsTag-769 fsTag-771 fsTag-781 fsTag-782 fsTag-806

div.p: GoNoodle provides movement and mindfulness activities for kids of all ages.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1258 fsCategory-1223 fsCategory-1224 fsCategory-1221 fsTag-770 fsTag-773 fsTag-774 fsTag-787 fsTag-788 fsTag-789

div.a: Google Art and Culture (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Amazing resource of world art, culture, history, and science

div.a: Google Classroom - Parent Guide (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: This document provides guidance for parents/guardians on how to use Google Classroom.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1258 fsCategory-1280 fsTag-782 fsTag-787

div.a: Google Museum View (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Google Museum View provides virtual tours of the world's greatest art museums.

div.p: To provide additional support for families, we've created sample schedules you can use as a template to create your student's own daily routine.

div.a: Grades 6-8 Weekly Schedule Example (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: To provide additional support for families, we've created sample schedules you can use as a template to create your student's own daily routine.

div.p: To provide additional support for families, we've created sample schedules you can use as a template to create your student's own daily routine.

div.p: To provide additional support for families, we've created sample schedules you can use as a template to create your student's own daily routine.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1255 fsTag-781

div.p: This post includes a sampling of gross motor activities.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1269 fsCategory-1223 fsTag-773 fsTag-774

div.p: Various biology concepts shared through engaging video with narrative explanation.

Use:
Free trial, family has the option to subscribe

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1245 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1223 fsCategory-1255 fsCategory-1224 fsCategory-1256 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-773 fsTag-774 fsTag-777 fsTag-778 fsTag-780 fsTag-782

div.p: Access thousands of short video tutorials on a variety of subjects from "making a spreadsheet" to "social emotional learning". Log in with your student account information.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1262 fsCategory-1261 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-773 fsTag-774

div.a: How to Learn Math (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: How to Learn Math is a free self-paced class for learners of all levels of mathematics. It combines important information on the brain with new evidence on the best ways to approach math effectively.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1261 fsTag-795

div.a: How to Talk to Your Kids About Coronavirus (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: This article that shares insights about how to talk to your child about coronavirus and school closures.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1224 fsTag-769 fsTag-770

div.p: Founded by Justice Sandra Day O'Connor, iCivics provides effective innovative, freely accessible resources that enhance practice and inspire classrooms.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1221 fsTag-777

div.p: iLit is a literacy suite to support English Language Development. If you student already has a login they've received from school, they can continue to access iLit at home.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsTag-777

div.p: Imagine Learning is an adaptive learning tool to support literacy and math. Currently, some of our emerging level English Learner students have Imagine Learning accounts they can access from home. We are in the process of working to provide this resource for all of our English Learner students.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1262 fsCategory-1261 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-795

div.a: iReady Family Video (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: This video by Curriculum Associates, the creators of iReady, helps explain how to appropriately use iReady to support student learning.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1255 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1262 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-777 fsTag-778 fsTag-781

div.a: iReady Online Reading and Math Instruction and Learning (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Students participate in adaptive practice of both reading and math topics. This video helps explain the purpose and appropriate use of iReady.iReady has also created additional resources available here.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-773 fsTag-774

div.a: Junior Library Guild: Digital (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: The Junior Library Guild digital reading platform has eBooks for Elementary, Middle and High School students. They are offering a free trial and are also available via library.nsd.org.
Use:District Owned (access via library.nsd.org) or they are offering a free trial, family has the option to subscribe

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1260 fsCategory-1262 fsCategory-1223 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1261 fsCategory-1255 fsTag-769 fsTag-771 fsTag-781 fsTag-795

div.a: K-5 Online Access Information for Families (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: This document helps provide login information for various websites referenced throughout the Home Learning website, as well as login information to resources teachers might ask students to access.
Subject(s): Reading, Health & Fitness, Math, and Science

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1255 fsTag-769 fsTag-771 fsTag-777 fsTag-778 fsTag-780 fsTag-781

div.p: Through a free membership to King County Public Library you can access Tumblebooks, a digital library that reads books aloud. While not a substitute for in-person reading, it can be a fun activity!

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1213 fsCategory-1218 fsCategory-1219 fsCategory-1220 fsCategory-1255 fsCategory-1224 fsCategory-1223 fsCategory-1262 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-773 fsTag-774 fsTag-775 fsTag-778 fsTag-781 fsTag-785 fsTag-790 fsTag-791

div.p: Khan Academy offers practice exercises, instructional videos and a personalized learning dashboard that empower learners to study at their own pace in and outside of the classroom. Parents/Guardians can learnto use Khan Academy by following this link:https://bit.ly/2QaeHkR.Khan Academy also provides translated content, please visit these websites for translation instructions: Changing the Language, Setting a New Default Language, and Enabling Subtitles.
Subject:Math, Social Studies, Science, SAT/ACT Prep, Coding, and Computer Science.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1261 fsTag-795

div.a: Khan Academy Example Schedules for School Closures (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Khan Academy has created schedules with Khan Academy resources, Podcasts, journaling, etc. for all student ages. This is a great resource for families that are looking for an optimal day of learning for their students.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1261 fsTag-795

div.a: Khan Academy Parent/Guardian Letter (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: A letter from Khan Academy that explains how their website can be used to support home learning.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1260 fsCategory-1261 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-770 fsTag-795 fsTag-806

div.p: Kids Health provides articles and resources for parents and students of all ages related to health and fitness.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1269 fsCategory-1280 fsTag-782

div.p: Kidz World is a social community where kids can chat, play games, post in forums and meet new friends.

Use:
Families have the choice to subscribe

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1269 fsCategory-1224 fsCategory-1223 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-785

div.a: Learn with Smithsonian (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Millions of Smithsonian digital images, recordings, texts, and videos in history, art and culture, and the sciences.
Use:Free lessons and resources. Fun Stuff With Kids does not require login. Learning Lab requires parent registration.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1221 fsCategory-1255 fsTag-770 fsTag-773 fsTag-774 fsTag-781 fsTag-785

div.p: Lit2Go is a collection of free stories and poems. It includes audio and print versions, as well as student activities.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1255 fsTag-780 fsTag-781

div.a: Living Well with Autism (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Living Well with Autismhas several resources for families of students with special needs. This specific page has visual schedules to help with daily routines such as morning and evening routines.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1262 fsTag-771

div.p: Math learning can occur daily using the environment around us! Try these math learning activities with your student using materials you may have around your home.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1245 fsTag-782

div.p: The following information is provided as a courtesy and does not constitute or imply recommendation or endorsement by the Northshore School District.
Please check with the insurance provider regarding coverage for counseling services. Some providers do not bill insurance but will provide billing codes for submission of claims.
Pediatricians, Primary Care Physicians (PCPs) are often the best place to start to pursue assessments, services. Some providers require referral from PCPs.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1222 fsCategory-1259 fsCategory-1223 fsTag-770 fsTag-774 fsTag-796 fsTag-797

div.a: Microsoft Imagine Cup Junior (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Imagine Cup Junior provides students aged 13-18 the opportunity to learn about technology and how it can be used to positively change the world. This years ICJ will focus on Artificial Intelligence.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1269 fsCategory-1280 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-773 fsTag-774 fsTag-782

div.p: All NSD students have access to login to Minecraft EDU, where they can join lessons on math, science, and other amazing topics. Download the Minecraft app and login with your NSD apps.nsd.org credentials. (Works on Mac, Windows)

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1267 fsTag-769 fsTag-770 fsTag-771 fsTag-773 fsTag-774 fsTag-780 fsTag-794

div.p: Music Lab allows students to compose their own songs, explore rhythms and much more!

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1223 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-769 fsTag-771

div.p: Mystery Science has short videos based on science questions with follow up discussion and activities.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1269 fsCategory-1223 fsTag-769 fsTag-771

div.a: NASA Science Space Place (opens in new window/tab)

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-1227 fsCategory-1223 fsCategory-1269 fsTag-795

div.a: Survive the Sound (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Survive the Sound,a free online education campaign, was developed in 2017 as a mechanism for bringing the science we do for salmon recovery to students and the general public. The program invites students, teachers, and families to learn about salmon and steelhead in Puget Sound by selecting a fun fish avatar and joining a team to participate in a friendly competition. Each fish represents areal fishthat we track through Puget Sound as part of our research. Last year, we had thousands of people participate.

During the month of April, Survive the Sound participants use activities from ourEducational Toolkit(NGSS-align, videos, activities, and more) to learn more about salmon and our local environment, while working to recruit friends and family to pick their own fish and join a team. The more people who join, the better your odds are at winning with the most surviving fish. Once the migration starts on May 4th, the teams are locked and the fish start leaving their rivers and swimming to the ocean. Over the 5-day migration(May 4-8),participants get daily updates on their fishs progress via an online map, learn facts about salmon and the Puget Sound ecosystem, and have an opportunity to form hypotheses while observing the, often interesting, fish behavior. Few fish will survive, but everyone learns about these miraculous fish while interacting with others from their home.
